From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To reserve a specified amount of memory in kilobytes for console access and critical notifications, use the **memory reserve** command in global configuration mode. To disable the configuration, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: Reserves the memory size for a console session.
Amount of memory to be reserved, in kilobytes. The range is from 1 to 4096.
Reserves the memory for critical notifications.
(Optional) Total amount of memory to be reserved, in kilobytes. The range is from 1 to 4294967295.

ExtraInfo: The **memory reserve console** command reserves enough memory to ensure console access to a CiscoÂ IOS device for administrative and troubleshooting purposes. This feature is especially beneficial when the device runs low on memory.The **memory reserve critical** command reserves the specified amount of memory in kilobytes so that the router can issue critical notifications. The amount of memory reserved for critical notifications cannot exceed 25 percent of the total available memory.

RelatedCmds.description: Configures a router to issue system logging message notifications when available memory falls below a specified threshold.
